UserProfile.title: User Profile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile in the system.

uid.description: The user's unique ID from Firebase Authentication.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the user profile was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Event entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the event.

startTime.description: The start date and time of the event.

endTime.description: The end date and time of the event.

location.description: The location where the event will take place.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Sermon entity.

speaker.description: The name of the sermon speaker.

date.description: The date the sermon was delivered.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Testimony entity.

author.description: The name of the testimony author.

date.description: The date the testimony was submitted.

content.description: The text content of the testimony.

approved.description: Indicates if the testimony is approved for public view. Defaults to false.

id.description: Unique identifier for the PrayerRequest entity.

author.description: The name of the prayer request author (can be anonymous).

date.description: The date the prayer request was submitted.

content.description: The text content of the prayer request.

isAnonymous.description: Indicates whether the prayer request should be displayed anonymously.

Donation.title: Donation
Donation.description: Represents a single donation transaction made by a user.

userId.description: The UID of the user who made the donation.

amount.description: Amount donated, in the smallest currency unit (e.g., Kobo).

purpose.description: The purpose of the giving (e.g., Tithes, Offerings).

status.description: The status of the transaction (e.g., success).

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the donation was recorded.

donorName.description: The name of the donor, fetched from their user profile.

donorEmail.description: The email of the donor, captured from the transaction.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support the VOSEM International website's features, focusing on secure and scalable data access. The structure prioritizes Authorization Independence by avoiding hierarchical authorization dependencies (`get()` calls in security rules). It also facilitates QAPs (Rules are not Filters) by segregating data with different access needs into separate collections.

*   **Users:** Stores user profiles. Each user can read and write their own profile.
*   **Events:** Stores church events. No specific ownership or membership is defined, assuming a general read access for all users and write access restricted to authorized personnel (e.g., admins). Segregation enables a simple rule where only authenticated users can read events, and only those with specific roles (not implemented here but could be easily added via a `/roles_event_admin/{uid}` collection check) can create/modify them.
*   **Sermons:** Stores recorded sermons. Similar to events, assumes general read access and restricted write access.
*   **Testimonies:** Stores user-submitted testimonies. All authenticated users can create, read, update and delete their own.
*   **Prayer Requests:** Stores user-submitted prayer requests.  This is a public write, private read scenario.
*   **Donations:** Stores transaction records from Paystack. These are written by the backend API and can only be read by the user who made the donation.
